name: Cairn Toul and Sgor an Lochain Uaine Trail

ai.summary: A short, easy out-and-back hike on a high-elevation trail in the UK. Despite the modest distance (0.4 km), conditions can be windy and visibility variable, so appropriate clothing and footing are important.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly easy, well-defined path with occasional rocky or uneven sections. Possible boggy patches after rain and exposed viewpoints where wind can be strong.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight; conditions can change rapidly in UK highland areas. Wear sturdy footwear and clothing layers; even short trails can be rocky and exposed. Stay on marked paths and carry navigation aids if visibility is reduced. Be prepared for wind and cooler temperatures at height; carry a warm layer. Bring water and a small snack, and inform someone of your plans. Follow Leave No Trace principles and take all rubbish with you.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) for dry, daylight-rich conditions; year-round hiking is possible with extra precautions in winter (short days, snow and ice possible).

seo.title: Cairn Toul and Sgor an Lochain Uaine Trail – Easy 0.4 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Cairn Toul and Sgor an Lochain Uaine Trail, a short, easy 0.4 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons to hike.
